posts.cooked:
We are trying to get localization working for our robot. We are using the limelight 3 and here is our code. We have the following problems.

We can’t get the auto starting state to have for our swerve drive pose estimator initalization.

Limelight updates the pose only once at the begining (if it can see it) and never again.

Pose 0, 0 is our starting state and not the orgin as we found out by runing a command that moves our robot to the orgin for testing.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
So I assume TrackingSubsystem is where your pose estimation is happening? You need to make sure you are updating your poseEstimator with your swerve measurements and your limelight measurements somewhere in your code. For example, you could add a new vision measurement (from your limelight) to the pose estimator in the periodic.

As for resetting your pose during auto, you can use resetPosition . We have our pose estimator in our swerve drive, but I’m sure you could figure something out to make it work with your TrackingSubsystem .

At the beginning of your autonomous command, just call this method with the initial pose of the trajectory.

Also, you should be updating your pose estimator with your module positions, probably in your swerve subsystem’s periodic.

Thanks for your reply. Would our TeleopTracking.java command set as default not work instead of using the periodic in the TrackingSubsystem . We did have the reset estimated pose for the pose estimator but we could not get our starting pose of our robot at the start of auto. Our problem is that our autos don’t have a designated starting position so we need to, at runtime, find this pose.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
Oh, I’m sorry, I didn’t see that command. Yes what you have can definitely work. I think the reason its not working is because you have booleans doRejectUpdate1 , doRejectUpdate2 , and doRejectUpdate3 , but you never set them to false. Initialize them to false and if the heading rate is under 720, set them to false.

What are you doing for autos? If you’re using pathplanner, you can get the initial pose from a trajectory.

We are using path planner but not for the starting position. We automatic pathfinding for the first path because of the inconsistant and inaccurate placement of the robot. I know that the placement is close to the correct position but I am looking to run the same auto from multiple different positions in case our alliance members have unique starting positions. To do this we use the PtathPlannerPath and the relative functions in it. The code that does this is not yet on github.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: If its close enough to the correct position, you could probably just reset it to the path’s initial pose, and then the limelights will correct for it, just really make sure you get the robot heading correct. As for running the same auto from multiple positions, I wouldn’t suggest doing that. Rather make a few different autos for a few different placements. But if you’re dead-set on doing that, you could decide on a few different starting positions and then use a sendable chooser to select the starting position for your auto.
I will look to do that. What would you recomend for the standard deviations for the limelights to correct the position of the robot?

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
Depends on how in depth you want to do it. My team variably changes the standard deviations based on how far away we are from the april tags, but if that sounds like too much work you could easily do something where you only add vision measurements when you’re 2 meters or closer.

This is the lookup table we use, maybe you could use some of those values? We have the rotation std dev really high because we trust our gyro not to drift very much during the match.

We got it generally working we just need to trust our gryo less. Thanks for the help we will inplement your reconmendations latter. Can you pease help with this function for the solution. The whole goal of this was to drive to a Pose2d (the sources). here is the functions that should do it and it does not. It does not follow at all or flip.
We added the updates to github

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
What gyro do you use? We use a navx and are pretty confident that it won’t significantly drift during the length of the match. Additionally, if you plan on using Mega tag 2, it might be risky to let your vision measurement affect the estimated heading.

As for endPoseToCommand , are you sure you are correctly configuring AutoBuilder? https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-build-an-auto.html#configure-autobuilder

We use the Pidgon 2 after our navX pins got bent and smashed. Our metatag 2 is update close to correct it just can be off on the rotation between 0-45 degrees.

Here is our config in the driveSubsystem for AutoBuilder.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: I’m not sure at this point. I would just really step through your code making sure that everything is correct. E.g. are all of your driveSubsystem methods working properly, are you correctly calling your path following command, etc.

We are using Photon Vison on multiple limlights and each of the limelights have the phton viosn firmware, but we can not access both of them at the same time. How would we fix this?

We are also still stepping through the code to ge the drive to pose.

posts.name: Dan
posts.cooked:
Make sure they both have different static IPs and/or different network names. Otherwise, they’ll both try to connect to the same mdns address (photonvision.local). They should both find a dynamic IP, but this can be annoying to find if you don’t have the right tools and background.

Easiest way to sort this out is power down, plug in one at a time, and then change the ID so they don’t conflict.
We set the limelight ip adresses to be static in photon vision. The front limelight is 10.31.79.201 and the back is 10.31.79.200. We are still having the same problem.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: Make sure your Settings/Hostname are different for each limelight. Try static IP addresses 10.31.79.11 and 10.31.79.12

It worked after we changed the host name. We are now getting updates from the limelights but we can’t drive to pose. I think that one of the issues could be FlippingUtil only flips it on the x axis and i am expecting it to flip on both axes.

The code follows it onece, to the wrong spot probally because of the flipping.

The code, after running one time, will not run again until a redeploy code.

This is our code. The code is in the following files: Subsystems/drive/driveSubsystem.java, Commands/Auto/GoToPose.java, Subsystems/drive/Poses.java, robotContainer.java

Thanks for the help getting the limelights going. This, if we can get it working will be the last thing in this localization problem. If nonething else comes up.

Update: The command now goes to the point sometimes but if we try again it says Command Loop Overrun. We have to wait for a long time and then reboot rio before it  will do it again. After that we enter the same loop mentioned above.
